messages.title: Election Communication
messages.content: Don't just vote for a politician. Elect a local champion for Argyll and Bute.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Presenting the case for an independent Scotland
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Presenting the case for an independent Scotland.
Fairer fuel prices especially in rural areas through introduction of a fuel duty regulator.
Ending the punitive transmission charges that heavily penalise renewable energy producers in Scotland.
Scrap Trident and liberate £100 Billion to be spent on front line services.
Scrap the ID card and spend £7 Billion on front line services.

issues.economy: The SNP are committed to increasing sustainable economic growth across Argyll and Bute.
issues.environment: By working together we can have a prosperous future while at the same time improving the quality of both the built and the natural environment.

leaflet.personalStatement: Argyll and Bute should be a prosperous area. This requires vision, leadership and political will. The SNP are committed to increasing sustainable economic growth across Argyll and Bute. By working together we can have a prosperous future while at the same time improving the quality of both the built and the natural environment.

contactInformation.address: Promoted by Kenneth MacColl, 24 Alexandra Place, Oban, Argyll on behalf of Mike MacKenzie, 1 Easdale Island, Oban, Argyll. Printed by CGL (Oban) Ltd, 15 Lochside Street, Oban, Argyll, Scotland PA34 4HP

quotes.text: Argyll and Bute should be a prosperous area. This requires vision, leadership and political will. The SNP are committed to increasing sustainable economic growth across Argyll and Bute. By working together we can have a prosperous future while at the same time improving the quality of both the built and the natural environment.

images.caption: Mike MacKenzie was born in Oban and has lived on Easdale Island since 1980 where he runs a successful building company.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The SNP Scottish Government has already: Abolished or reduced business rates for thousands of small businesses. Abolished student tuition fees. Reduced Prescription Charges with these to be completely abolished next year. Frozen Council Tax for three successive years. Introduced the RET pilot scheme.
